page.title: 02Conservation and Leisure.
page.content: The Peak is cared for by the D.of E. and facilities include, picnic area, information centre,toilets & car park. The centre of the site is the Nympsfield Long Barrow,a three chambered tomb of the Neolithic Period 2500BC.The mound was first excavated in 1862 when the chambers were partly destroyed.Later work uncovered a short passage from the east.Pottery vessels and sixteen skeletons were found.The shape of the mound is easy to see. From the hill there is a clear view of the River Severn and Vale of Berkeley. The grazing land is rich in meadow grasses,clovers,vetch and insect life.Buckholt Wood covers part of the hillside and Oak,Ash,Hawthorn, Dogwood,Elder and Guelder Rose grow. Frocester Hill Nature Reserve,owned by the National Trust is cared for by Glos.Trust for Nature Conservation.
